intro: Thelypodium repandum, commonly known as the common thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize open areas. Thelypodium repandum is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
